intro: Dimorphotheca multifida, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features showy yellow flowers with white ray florets, arranged in a composite head. Its leaves are typically lobed and hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun conditions.
